Milkomeda 是一个开创性的新协议，它为非 EVM 区块链提供了EVM 功能。 随着开发进程的推进，Milkomeda将扩展为几个主要区块链：包括卡Cardano、Solana和Algorand提供L2解决方案(rollups)。 Currently we have an EVM-based sidechain connected to Cardano - Milkomeda C1 and EVM-based Rollup connected to Algorand - Milkomeda A1. 按照本指南中的步骤，快速开始使用 Milkomeda。

Milkomeda 为非 EVM 生态系统提供了继承关键元素的能力，例如来自基于EVM生态系统的rollup和 Solidity支援。 开发者可以使用来自EVM生态系统的所有工具。 建筑、部署、调试和审计所有工作都与以太坊相同。 开发者将项目从以太坊移植过来的能力，将大大拓宽支持的L1区块链上可用的dApps选择。 多链部署的代码具有相同的安全属性，无需对每个链进行单独审计。 未来的零知识技术的创新，将作为L3+解决方案在Milkomeda之上实现。 Milkomeda使初创企业能够在Cardano、Algorand和Solana等链上建立。 同时利用最大的智能合约社区(Solidity) 的人才和资源。

可扩展性：Milkomeda可以在不牺牲长期分散性的情况下，扩展到每秒数百个交易。 安全性：我们的目标是利用所有区块链的卷积力量，在路线图的关键点进行审计，以确保协议的安全性。 用户体验：我们与钱包合作，以确保将资产转移到Milkomeda是轻而易举的。 互操作性：Solidity（EVM）的支援将是第一位的，其次是Cairo和其他。 可移植性：你只需要编码一次，然后它就可以在不牺牲安全的情况下到处利用。 开发者经验：开发者可以直接利用以太坊的所有工具和资源。
终端用户可以从Cardano主网发送ADA到一个桥接地址，并在 Milkomeda C1 侧链上接收包装好的ADA。 跳转到终端用户入门页面，开始设置Flint和MetaMask。

In addition to the mainnet version of the Milkomeda C1 sidechain which uses wrapped ADA for fees and gas, developers can also access the Milkomeda Devnet to wrap assets from the Cardano Preprod Testnet and deploy smart contracts on the Milkomeda C1 Devnet sidechain using wrapped Test ADA for fees and gas. 进入下一页，开始设置 Flint 钱包，并从Cardano Testnet龙头获得一些测试ADA。

End users can send ALGO from the Algorand mainnet to a bridge address and receive wrapped ALGO on the Milkomeda A1 Rollup. End users can send ALGO from the Algorand mainnet to a bridge address and receive wrapped ALGO on the Milkomeda A1 Rollup. Jump ahead to the Getting Started for End Users page to start by setting up MyAlgo wallet and MetaMask to interact with bridge dApp.

In addition to the mainnet version of the Milkomeda A1 Rollup which uses wrapped ALGO for fees and gas, developers can also access the Milkomeda A1 Devnet to wrap assets from the Algorand Testnet and deploy smart contracts on the Milkomeda A1 Devnet Rollup using wrapped Test ALGO for fees and gas. Proceed to the next page to start by setting up MyAlgo Wallet and obtaining some test ALGO from the Algorand Testnet faucet. Proceed to the next page to start by setting up MyAlgo Wallet and obtaining some test ALGO from the Algorand Testnet faucet.

Milkomeda is a protocol designed to improve blockchain interoperability by delivering EVM capabilities to non-EVM blockchains. This is done by building layer 2 (L2) scaling solutions such as rollups, on which the EVM operates, and connecting these to the non-EVM blockchains, layer 1 (L1), via a permission-less bridge. A rollup is described as a “layer 2” chain. A rollup is described as a “layer 2” chain. Layer 2 means that it lives on top of an existing blockchain, which is called the layer 1 or main chain, and thus is able to take advantage of the layer 1’s native, built-in properties. The Milkomeda A1 Rollup uses MilkALGO as its base asset for paying fees and gas. To access the Rollup, you will need a Algorand native wallet with some $ALGO, as well as the MetaMask wallet. In the following pages we will walk through the steps to create a MyAlgo wallet, configure MetaMask to get a Milkomeda A1 address, send ALGOs to be converted into MilkALGO on Milkomeda Algorand Rollup, and, finally, deploying a smart-contract. 我们建议先从devnet开始，以了解其方向。 Once you’re familiar with the devnet, the operations for the mainnet are the same. Once you’re familiar with the devnet, the operations for the mainnet are the same. The example steps that follow will show how to set up a connection to the both devnet and mainnet.

备注 In the previous step we showed you how to get the ALGO testnet to start interacting with Milkomeda A1 Rollup Testnet. From now on, documentation will be focused on mainnet settings. Nevertheless, we recommend that you first interact with Milkomeda A1 Rollup using testnet funds. For this purpose change the corresponding RPC settings to Testnet. Please keep in mind, that all the steps described for mainnet settings are the same as the ones for testnet. Now that we have an Algorand wallet and some ALGOs, we need an address on the Milkomeda Algorand A1 Rollup where we can receive our MilkALGO. We recommend using MetaMask for this step. We recommend using MetaMask for this step. First, install MetaMask for Chrome, then click the Chrome Extensions icon and select MetaMask. 在MetaMask窗口，点击「开始」然后,「创建一个钱包」。 在MetaMask窗口，点击「开始」然后,「创建一个钱包」。 设置钱包密码，并点击完成其余的设置屏幕。 When you're finished, you will have a new, empty wallet, as shown below. When you're finished, you will have a new, empty wallet, as shown below. Select the network dropdown in the top right corner of the MetaMask screen. 从下拉列表中，选择「添加网络」，并输入以下内容： Network Name: Milkomeda Algorand mainnet New RPC URL: https://rpc-mainnet-algorand-rollup.a1.milkomeda.com Chain ID: 2002 Currency Symbol (Optional): milkAlgo Block Explorer URL (Optional): https://explorer-mainnet-algorand-rollup.a1.milkomeda.com To interact with Milkomeda A1 Testnet, use following network details: 网络名称: Milkomeda Algorand Testnet New RPC URL: https://rpc-devnet-algorand-rollup.a1.milkomeda.com Chain ID: 200202 Currency Symbol (Optional): milkTALGO Block Explorer URL (Optional): https://testnet-algorand-rollup.a1.milkomeda.com Click “Save”, and you will now see Milkomeda Algorand in the network dropdown list. Copy your Milkomeda Algorand wallet address from MetaMask to the clipboard by clicking on the account name, as shown. Copy your Milkomeda Algorand wallet address from MetaMask to the clipboard by clicking on the account name, as shown. Next we will go to the Milkomeda A1 Bridge dApp and send our ALGO to the Bridge to be wrapped.

这里我们将在Milkomeda A1 rollup，部署一个Solidity智能合约。 在这个例子中，我们将使用Remix 来部署合同。 你可以通过访问以下链接访问Remix：Remix IDE 首先，创建solidity智能合约文件。 在Remix窗口内，点击左侧面板的「合约」文件夹，然后点击中央面板的 「新文件 」按钮。 现在你将被提示，为新的 Solidity 智能合约输入一个文件名。 文件名是任意的，但为了这个例子，我们将部署一个ERC-20智能合约，所以我们将文件命名为 「Test_ERC20.sol」。 输入文件名并按输入. 光标应移至编辑面板，您可在此输入您的 Solidity 代码。 光标应移至编辑面板，您可在此输入您的 Solidity 代码。 输入以下内容： pragma solidity ^0.7.0; import "https://github.com/OpenZeppelin/openzeppelin-contracts/blob/v3.4.0-solc-0.7/contracts/token/ERC20/ERC20.sol"; contract Token is ERC20 { constructor () ERC20("Token", "TKN") { _mint(msg.sender, 1000000 * (10 ** uint256(decimals()))); } } 接下来，点击屏幕左侧的「Solidity编译器」 图标，选择一个编译器版本(对于这个例子，我们将使用 0.7.6+commit.7338295f), 然后点击「编译Test_ERC20.sol」，如图所示。 点击左边的「部署和运行交易」图标，从 「环境」下拉选择 「Injected Web3」如图所示。 This will bring up the MetaMask screen where you will need to click "Next" and then "Connect" to connect your A1 wallet with Remix. 现在你的MetaMask钱包已经连接好了，点击「部署」按钮，将智能合约部署到Milkomeda A1 Rollup。 在MetaMask中确认该交易。 现在您应该在Remix IDE屏幕左侧的「已部署的合同」 下看到以下内容。 你可以复制ERC20智能合约的地址，并在Metamask中使用它来添加你最近创建的代币。 点击导入代币，然后贴上合同地址。 最后，点击添加自定代币，你应该可以看到你的代币了！ 现在你能够转让它们，并与智能合约互动。

首先，我们建议从官方的测试网分配器 https://testnet.algoexplorer.io/dispenser 获得一些测试网ALGO。 此外，目前我们建议使用MyAlgo钱包https://wallet.myalgo.com/来设置一个与Milkomeda A1桥兼容的测试网钱包(需要在Algorand测试网和Rollup之间移动资金)。 等待几分钟后(通常2分钟或更短)，你应该能在你的Algorand Testnet钱包中看到一些tALGO。 接下来我们将设置MetaMask，并在Milkomeda A1 Algorand Rollup上获得一个地址。

In order to transfer assets from Algorand (mainchain) to the Milkomeda A1 Rollup, you need to use our dedicated Bridge dApp. To wrap your assets onto the A1 Rollup go to the Milkomeda A1 bridge dApp at https://algorand-bridge.milkomeda.com/. To wrap your assets onto the A1 Rollup go to the Milkomeda A1 bridge dApp at https://algorand-bridge.milkomeda.com/. To start wrapping your assets, choose the Algorand to Milkomeda direction from the "Network Origin" dropdown menu. Then select the token you want to wrap (in this tutorial, we will use ALGO) from the "Select Token" dropdown menu. Then select the token you want to wrap (in this tutorial, we will use ALGO) from the "Select Token" dropdown menu. The next step is to log in to your MyAlgo and MetaMask wallets. Click “Connect Wallet” on the Origin side and your MyAlgo wallet (we recently added support for Pera wallet too) will require you to enter your password and confirm which account to connect to the dApp. Your available ALGO balance will then be displayed below the "Select Token" field. Your available ALGO balance will then be displayed below the "Select Token" field. Click “Connect Wallet” on the Destination side of the dApp and your Metamask wallet will ask you to confirm that you want to switch networks (if you are not already connected to it) to the Milkomeda A1 network. Enter how many ALGOs you want to transfer to the A1 rollup (if you want to send your whole balance click “Max” to have the bridge calculate the maximum amount you can send minus the transaction fee). Click “Next” to view a transaction summary, complete with “Estimated Fees” and an “Estimated Wrapping Confirmation Time”. Click “Sign and Send”, enter your wallet password, and hit confirm. Click “Sign and Send”, enter your wallet password, and hit confirm. Now watch as your tokens get sent to the bridge, wrapped, and sent to your MetaMask wallet on the Milkomeda Algorand A1 Rollup! 这个进程需要大约20秒钟才能确认。 这个进程需要大约20秒钟才能确认。 info Remember that transactions from the Rollup are written to the Algorand blockchain itself. So one confirmation is for sending funds from the wallet to the bridge address and the second confirmation is for the rollup batch transaction on Algorand. ::: 转移只需要总共2次确认--这应该需要大约20秒(Algorand为4.5秒，Rollup的批次为14秒左右)。 Once the transaction is confirmed, the transferred MilkALGO should be visible in your Milkomeda Algorand wallet in MetaMask. You can now watch your transaction pass through the bridge. Congratulations! You just wrapped your tokens onto on of the first rollups outside of the Ethereum ecosystem! Now that we have successfully wrapped ALGO into MilkALGO for use on the Milkomeda A1 Algorand Rollup, the next step is to deploy a sample smart contract. If you want to learn how to unwrap MilkALGOs, you can find out how to do that by visiting Unwrapping Assets. ::: :::

Milkomeda is a protocol designed to improve blockchain interoperability by delivering EVM capabilities to non-EVM blockchains. This is done by building layer 2 (L2) scaling solutions such as rollups, on which the EVM operates, and connecting these to the non-EVM blockchains, layer 1 (L1), via a permission-less bridge. A rollup is described as a “layer 2” chain. A rollup is described as a “layer 2” chain. Layer 2 means that it lives on top of an existing blockchain, which is called the layer 1 or main chain, and thus is able to take advantage of the layer 1’s native, built-in properties. The Milkomeda A1 Rollup uses MilkALGO as its base asset for paying fees and gas. To access the Rollup, you will need a Algorand native wallet with some $ALGO, as well as the MetaMask wallet. In the following pages we will walk through the steps to create a MyAlgo wallet, configure MetaMask to get a Milkomeda A1 address, and, finally, to send ALGOs to be converted into MilkALGO on Milkomeda Algorand Rollup. In this tutorial, you will also learn how to transfer funds back to Algorand in a process called unwrapping. In addition, we'll talk about what Algorand Standard Assets (ASAs) are and what you need to do to prepare to move these assets between the mainchain (Algorand) and the Rollup (Milkomeda). In addition, we'll talk about what Algorand Standard Assets (ASAs) are and what you need to do to prepare to move these assets between the mainchain (Algorand) and the Rollup (Milkomeda). This section gives a brief introduction of the Algorand Standard Assets (ASAs) supported by the Milkomeda A1 Rollup Bridge and how to move ASAs (wrapping or unwrapping) between the Milkomeda A1 Rollup and the mainchain (Algorand). Before we go through the step-by-step instruction of how to wrap and unwrap ASAs using the Milkomeda A1 Bridge it’s important to understand what ASAs are. Before we go through the step-by-step instruction of how to wrap and unwrap ASAs using the Milkomeda A1 Bridge it’s important to understand what ASAs are.

The Algorand Standard Assets (ASAs) are the on-chain assets supported by Algorand that ensures the same security, compatibility and speed as its native currency - Algo. ASAs can represent stablecoins, in-game currencies, loyalty points, etc. They can also represent single assets, like collectibles. ASAs can represent stablecoins, in-game currencies, loyalty points, etc. They can also represent single assets, like collectibles. info ASAs that are multiple assets of the same type can be called "fungible assets” - stablecoins, for example. Those that are unique are called non-fungible assets. Learn more about ASAs: https://developer.algorand.org/docs/get-details/asa/ ::: Those that are unique are called non-fungible assets. Learn more about ASAs: https://developer.algorand.org/docs/get-details/asa/ Now let's go over how to add an Algorand Standard Asset to a native Algorand Wallet so you can then move it using the Milkomeda A1 Bridge.

info To be able to receive any ASA you first need to opt-in your account for the asset. Any account can receive Algorand Standard Assets, but a potential recipient of a specific ASA must first opt-in to the asset so that the account holder cannot be sent assets without professing a prior desire to receive that asset. "Opting In" to an asset is simply an asset transfer of 0 to and from the opting-in account. In this process you are adding a specific asset to your account before transferring it. ::: Any account can receive Algorand Standard Assets, but a potential recipient of a specific ASA must first opt-in to the asset so that the account holder cannot be sent assets without professing a prior desire to receive that asset. "Opting In" to an asset is simply an asset transfer of 0 to and from the opting-in account. In this process you are adding a specific asset to your account before transferring it. A Step-By-Step Guide to opt EURe into Your MyAlgo Wallet​ Open your MyAlgo wallet. Press the "Add Asset" button on the right, as highlighted in the image below. Input the ASA ID or its symbol (12400859 or EURE). If you are having trouble finding this particular ASA make sure that your Wallet is connected to the Algorand testnet (in the upper right corner). Wait until EURe with a value of 0 appears in the list of assets in your account. Now, your account can receive EURe from the testnet dispenser!
documents.s: How to add an ASA to an Algorand Wallet

documents.t: For the purpose of this tutorial we will only focus on testnet Euros, which is the default ASA available from the official Algorand Testnet Dispenser. Go through the steps below to acquire your first testnet EURes. Go to https://testnet.algoexplorer.io/dispenser Select "Testnet Euros" from the drop-down list, as shown in the image below. Paste your Algorand wallet address. Complete the required anti-bot verification. Click "Dispense" button to receive your Testnet Euros. Once you've received your testnet Euros you are ready to start interacting with the Milkomeda | Algorand A1 Rollup Bridge. How cool is that! How cool is that!

备注 In this tutorial, in order to best show the process, we will use the tesnet ASA that is EURe. :::note In this tutorial, in order to best show the process, we will use the tesnet ASA that is EURe. If you want to wrap/unwrap mainnet assets - use this tutorial by replacing EURe with any other token supported by Milkomeda A1 mainnet bridge. A list of available assets can be found in: Algorand Bridge Supported ASA ::: A list of available assets can be found in: Algorand Bridge Supported ASA Go to the Milkomeda A1 Bridge dApp at https://algorand-bridge-dev.milkomeda.com/. To start wrapping your assets, choose Algorand to Milkomeda direction from the "Network Origin" dropdown menu. Then select the appropriate token (EURe) from the "Select Token" dropdown menu. 注意 Remember, you must have a minimum amount of ALGO tokens in your Algorand wallet to move EURe as it is used to pay the transaction fee on the mainchain. ::: Enter how many test EURe you want to transfer to the A1 rollup. Click “Next” to view a transaction summary, complete with “Estimated Fees” and an “Estimated Wrapping Confirmation Time”. Click “Sign and Send”, enter your MyAlgo wallet password, confirm the transaction, and watch as your tokens get sent to the Bridge, wrapped, and sent to your MetaMask wallet on the Milkomeda Algorand A1 Rollup! info The transfer only requires a total of 2 confirmations, which should take approximately 20 seconds (4.5 seconds for Algorand and around 14 seconds for the batch of the Rollup). ::: You can now watch your transaction pass through the Bridge. Once the transaction is confirmed you should add the ASA to your MetaMask wallet. Use the "Import Assets to Metamask" button, found below the Network Confirmation section, to see the wrapped EURe in your Metamask Wallet. This button will bring up your MetaMask wallet and suggest that you add the wrapped ASA to your wallet, as shown in the image below. This button will bring up your MetaMask wallet and suggest that you add the wrapped ASA to your wallet, as shown in the image below. Click Add Token to be able to view your wrapped ASA in your MetaMask wallet.
documents.s: Wrapping Algorand Standard Assets with the Milkomeda Bridge

documents.t: Go to the Milkomeda A1 Bridge dApp at https://algorand-bridge-dev.milkomeda.com/. To start wrapping your assets, choose Algorand to Milkomeda direction from the "Network Origin" dropdown menu. Then select the appropriate token (EURe) from the "Select Token" dropdown menu. Go to the Milkomeda A1 Bridge dApp at https://algorand-bridge-dev.milkomeda.com/. To start unwrapping your assets, choose the Milkomeda to Algorand direction from the "Network Origin" dropdown menu. Then select the appropriate token (EURe) from the "Select Token" dropdown menu. Then select the appropriate token (EURe) from the "Select Token" dropdown menu. Enter how many test EURe you want to transfer back to Algorand. Enter how many test EURe you want to transfer back to Algorand. Click “Next” to view a transaction summary, complete with “Estimated Fees” and an “Estimated Wrapping Confirmation Time”. 注意 Remember, you must have a minimum of 1 test milkALGO in your MetaMask wallet to move EURe as milkALGO is the currency in which Bridge fees are paid when unwrapping. ::: Click “Sign and Send”, and your MetaMask Wallet will show-up. Now you need to approve an ERC-20 allowance. Now you need to approve an ERC-20 allowance. info Giving ERC20 allowance simply means that the user grants another contract/address permission to transfer their ERC20 tokens. In other words, it allows other addresses to spend the token. ::: In other words, it allows other addresses to spend the token. After ERC-20 Allowance is confirmed in MetaMask the dApp will wait to receive the allowance approval from the EVM. In our scenario we are approving the transfer of ERC20 tokens (e.g. EURe) by the Bridge contract. As a result, the contract is able to move the token from the user’s account on the EVM to the Bridge, where the unwrapping is performed. As a result, the contract is able to move the token from the user’s account on the EVM to the Bridge, where the unwrapping is performed. Once the ERC20 allowance is approved, we can proceed to submitting an unwrapping request. MetaMask will pop up once again to ask for approval of the requested transaction. MetaMask will pop up once again to ask for approval of the requested transaction. In the last step of the ASA unwrapping procedure a 1 MILKALGO unwrapping fee must be paid to the validators to process the unwrapping request. Congratulations! You’ve just unwrapped your ASA from the Milkomeda Algorand Rollup back to the Algorand!
documents.s: Unwrapping Algorand Standard Assets with the Milkomeda Bridge

documents.t: 备注 In the previous step we showed you how to get the ALGO testnet to start interacting with Milkomeda A1 Rollup Testnet. From now on, documentation will be focused on mainnet settings. Nevertheless, we recommend that you first interact with Milkomeda A1 Rollup using testnet funds. For this purpose change the corresponding RPC settings to Testnet. Please keep in mind, that all the steps described for mainnet settings are the same as the ones for testnet. From now on, documentation will be focused on mainnet settings. Nevertheless, we recommend that you first interact with Milkomeda A1 Rollup using testnet funds. For this purpose change the corresponding RPC settings to Testnet. Please keep in mind, that all the steps described for mainnet settings are the same as the ones for testnet. ::: Now that we have an Algorand wallet and some ALGOs, we need an address on the Milkomeda Algorand A1 Rollup where we can receive our MilkALGO. We recommend using MetaMask for this step. We recommend using MetaMask for this step. First, install MetaMask for Chrome, then click the Chrome Extensions icon and select MetaMask. 在MetaMask窗口，点击「开始」然后,「创建一个钱包」。 在MetaMask窗口，点击「开始」然后,「创建一个钱包」。 设置钱包密码，并点击完成其余的设置屏幕。 When you're finished, you will have a new, empty wallet, as shown below. When you're finished, you will have a new, empty wallet, as shown below. Select the network dropdown in the top right corner of the MetaMask screen. 从下拉列表中，选择「添加网络」，并输入以下内容： Network Name: Milkomeda Algorand mainnet New RPC URL: https://rpc-mainnet-algorand-rollup.a1.milkomeda.com Chain ID: 2002 Currency Symbol (Optional): milkAlgo Block Explorer URL (Optional): https://explorer-mainnet-algorand-rollup.a1.milkomeda.com **To interact with Milkomeda A1 Testnet, use following network details:** 网络名称: Milkomeda Algorand Testnet New RPC URL: https://rpc-devnet-algorand-rollup.a1.milkomeda.com Chain ID: 200202 Currency Symbol (Optional): milkTALGO Block Explorer URL (Optional): https://testnet-algorand-rollup.a1.milkomeda.com Click “Save”, and you will now see Milkomeda Algorand in the network dropdown list. Copy your Milkomeda Algorand wallet address from MetaMask to the clipboard by clicking on the account name, as shown. Copy your Milkomeda Algorand wallet address from MetaMask to the clipboard by clicking on the account name, as shown. Next we will go to the Milkomeda A1 Bridge dApp and send our ALGO to the Bridge to be wrapped.

In order to interact with the Milkomeda Algorand Rollup Bridge, you need to configure a native Algorand wallet. We recommend using MyAlgo wallet to setup a testnet wallet compatible with the Milkomeda A1 Bridge. We recommend using MyAlgo wallet to setup a testnet wallet compatible with the Milkomeda A1 Bridge.
documents.s: Configuring Algorand Wallet and obtaining Test ALGO

documents.t: First, go to https://wallet.myalgo.com/new-account. After accepting the Terms of Service click Continue to start configuring your wallet. In the next step you will be asked to create a password. Then you should create a new randomly generated account. After accepting the Terms of Service click Continue to start configuring your wallet. In the next step you will be asked to create a password. Then you should create a new randomly generated account. In the next step you will be asked to save the Mnemonic Phrase. info Remember to take note of the following Mnemonic Phrase words in the correct order. They are the recovery phrase for your new account. 注意 Do not share these words with anyone! These words can be used to steal all your funds. Once you've successfully verified the Mnemonic Phrase your MyAlgo wallet has been configured and all that's left to do is to give your wallet a name of your choosing.

To interact with the Bridge dApp you need to have the testnet ALGO token, ALGO. 首先，我们建议从官方的测试网分配器 https://testnet.algoexplorer.io/dispenser 获得一些测试网ALGO。 首先，我们建议从官方的测试网分配器 https://testnet.algoexplorer.io/dispenser 获得一些测试网ALGO。 Enter your newly created Algorand address and after waiting a few minutes (usually 2 minutes or less), you should be able to see some tALGO in your Algorand Testnet wallet. Next we will set up MetaMask Wallet and get an address on the Milkomeda A1 Algorand Rollup.

To move assets from the Milkomeda Algorand Rollup back to Algorand (in a process called unwrapping), first go to Milkomeda Bridge dApp. Follow the steps below to unwrap milkALGO and to receive ALGO in your Algorand wallet. Follow the steps below to unwrap milkALGO and to receive ALGO in your Algorand wallet. Go to the Milkomeda A1 bridge dApp at https://algorand-bridge.milkomeda.com/. To start unwrapping your assets, choose the Milkomeda to Algorand option from the "Network Origin" dropdown menu. Then select the token you want to unwrap (in our example, we will use the milkALGO token) from "Select Token" dropdown menu. To start unwrapping your assets, choose the Milkomeda to Algorand option from the "Network Origin" dropdown menu. Then select the token you want to unwrap (in our example, we will use the milkALGO token) from "Select Token" dropdown menu. Click “Connect Wallet” on the Origin side and your Metamask wallet will ask you to confirm that you want to switch networks (if you are not already connected to it) to the Milkomeda A1 network. Your available milkALGO balance will then be displayed below the Select Token field. Your available milkALGO balance will then be displayed below the Select Token field. Click “Connect Wallet” on the “Destination” side of the dApp and your MyAlgo wallet will require you to enter your password and confirm which account to connect to the dApp. Enter how many milkALGO you want to transfer back to the Algorand (if you want to send your whole balance click “Max” to have the bridge calculate the maximum amount you can send minus the transaction fee). Click “Next” to view a transaction summary, complete with “Estimated Fees” and an “Estimated Wrapping Confirmation Time”. Click “Sign and Send”, confirm the transaction in your Metamask wallet and then watch as your tokens get sent to the bridge, unwrapped, and sent to your MyAlgo wallet on Algorand! The process should take around 90 seconds to confirm. The process should take around 90 seconds to confirm. info Moving assets the other way (from the Layer 2 to Algorand) requires the user to interact with the bridge’s smart contract in order to request their unwrapping. The validators will then coordinate to build the transaction to release the assets from their custody on the mainchain. Each validator (at least the quorum) needs to provide the necessary signatures in order to validate the transaction on chain. ::: The validators will then coordinate to build the transaction to release the assets from their custody on the mainchain. Each validator (at least the quorum) needs to provide the necessary signatures in order to validate the transaction on chain. Once the transaction is confirmed, the transferred ALGO should be visible in your Algorand wallet. Congratulations! You’ve just unwrapped your tokens from the Milkomeda Algorand Rollup to Algorand! Now that we have successfully unwrapped milkALGO from the Milkomeda Algorand Rollup to the Algorand let’s talk about moving Algorand Standard Assets (ASAs) using the Milkomeda Rollup Bridge.

In order to transfer assets from Algorand (mainchain) to the Milkomeda A1 Rollup, you need to use our dedicated Bridge dApp. To wrap your assets onto the A1 Rollup go to the Milkomeda A1 bridge dApp at https://algorand-bridge.milkomeda.com/. To wrap your assets onto the A1 Rollup go to the Milkomeda A1 bridge dApp at https://algorand-bridge.milkomeda.com/. To start wrapping your assets, choose the Algorand to Milkomeda direction from the "Network Origin" dropdown menu. Then select the token you want to wrap (in this tutorial, we will use ALGO) from the "Select Token" dropdown menu. Then select the token you want to wrap (in this tutorial, we will use ALGO) from the "Select Token" dropdown menu. The next step is to log in to your MyAlgo and MetaMask wallets. Click “Connect Wallet” on the Origin side and your MyAlgo wallet (we recently added support for Pera wallet too) will require you to enter your password and confirm which account to connect to the dApp. Your available ALGO balance will then be displayed below the "Select Token" field. Your available ALGO balance will then be displayed below the "Select Token" field. Click “Connect Wallet” on the Destination side of the dApp and your Metamask wallet will ask you to confirm that you want to switch networks (if you are not already connected to it) to the Milkomeda A1 network. Enter how many ALGOs you want to transfer to the A1 rollup (if you want to send your whole balance click “Max” to have the bridge calculate the maximum amount you can send minus the transaction fee). Click “Next” to view a transaction summary, complete with “Estimated Fees” and an “Estimated Wrapping Confirmation Time”. Click “Sign and Send”, enter your wallet password, and hit confirm. Click “Sign and Send”, enter your wallet password, and hit confirm. Now watch as your tokens get sent to the bridge, wrapped, and sent to your MetaMask wallet on the Milkomeda Algorand A1 Rollup! 这个进程需要大约20秒钟才能确认。 这个进程需要大约20秒钟才能确认。 info Remember that transactions from the Rollup are written to the Algorand blockchain itself. So one confirmation is for sending funds from the wallet to the bridge address and the second confirmation is for the rollup batch transaction on Algorand. ::: So one confirmation is for sending funds from the wallet to the bridge address and the second confirmation is for the rollup batch transaction on Algorand. 转移只需要总共2次确认--这应该需要大约20秒(Algorand为4.5秒，Rollup的批次为14秒左右)。 Once the transaction is confirmed, the transferred MilkALGO should be visible in your Milkomeda Algorand wallet in MetaMask. You can now watch your transaction pass through the bridge. Congratulations! You just wrapped your tokens onto on of the first rollups outside of the Ethereum ecosystem! Now that we have successfully wrapped ALGO into MilkALGO, for use on the Milkomeda A1 Algorand Rollup, let's see how to move assets from Milkomeda A1 Rollup to Algorand.

Two versions of the Milkomeda C1 sidechain are currently operational. One is the devnet version, which uses test ADA and interacts with the Cardano Preprod Testnet. 另一个是主网版本，它使用真实的ADA并与Cardano主网互动。 我们建议先从devnet开始，以了解其方向。 一旦你熟悉了devnet，对未来主网的操作也将是一样的。 下面的例子步骤将显示如何设置与devnet的连接，另外的部分用红色文字表示参数和使用主网的步骤。 我们的第一步是安装Flint钱包。 前往下一页开始。

Flint Wallet是一个Chrome扩展程序，作为DeFi和NFT的常用轻型钱包。 当前版本的Flint允许用户创建一个Cardano Testnet钱包，并启用 "Milkomeda模式"，将交易发送到Milkomeda C1侧链。 在使用Chrome浏览器时访问以下链接，并点击 「添加到Chrome 」按钮，即可安装Flint Wallet: 安装Flint 钱包​ 安装后，点击Chrome窗口右上方的扩展程序图标，选择Flint钱包。 在Flint窗口中，通过最初的警告屏幕，点击 「让我开始」，选择你的语言，点击「我同意」，当你到达下图所示屏幕时，点击「Testnet」按钮。 info 要在Milkomeda C1的主网版本上使用真正的ADA，请点击 "主网"，创建一个主网的Cardano钱包来代替。 接下来，点击「确认」，「创建一个新钱包」，并写下你的恢复短语的副本。 在下一个屏幕上确认恢复短语，设置一个钱包密码，并点击「创建我的钱包」。 现在你可以在应用程序密码界面选择「跳过」，然后点击「完成」。 你现在应该有一个Cardano Testnet钱包，如图所示： 接下来，我们将访问Cardano Testnet龙头，获得一些测试ADA。

现在我们有一个Cardano测试网钱包和一些测试用ADA，我们需要一个 Milkomeda Cardano Testnet侧链的地址，在那里我们可以收到我们的MilkTADA。 目前，我们建议使用MetaMask来完成这一步骤。 首先，安装Chrome浏览器的MetaMask。 然后，点击Chrome扩展程序图标 并选择MetaMask。 在MetaMask窗口，点击「开始」然后,「创建一个钱包」。 设置钱包密码，并点击完成其余的设置屏幕。 完成后，你应该如下图所示，有一个新的空钱包。 选择MetaMask屏幕右上方的网络下拉菜单。 从下拉列表中，选择「添加网络」，并输入以下内容： Network Name: Milkomeda Cardano Testnet New RPC URL: https://rpc-devnet-cardano-evm.c1.milkomeda.com Chain ID: 200101 Currency Symbol (Optional): milkTADA Block Explorer URL (Optional): https://explorer-devnet-cardano-evm.c1.milkomeda.com 如果你需要一个WebSocket端点，请使用：wss://rpc-devnet-cardano-evm.c1.milkomeda.com info 如果要使用Milkomeda C1的主网版本，请输入以下参数代替： Network Name: Milkomeda Cardano (C1) New RPC URL: https://rpc-mainnet-cardano-evm.c1.milkomeda.com Chain ID: 2001 Currency Symbol: milkADA Block Explorer URL: https://explorer-mainnet-cardano-evm.c1.milkomeda.com 如果你需要一个WebSocket端点，请使用以下内容：wss://rpc-mainnet-cardano-evm.c1.milkomeda.com ::: 点击「保存」，你现在应该在网络下拉菜单中看到「Milkomeda Cardano Testnet」。 点击账户名称，将您的Milkomeda Cardano Testnet钱包地址复制到剪贴板上，如图所示。 接下来我们将回到Flint钱包，将我们的测试ADA送去包装。

这里我们将在Milkomeda C1侧链，部署一个Solidity智能合约。 在这个例子中，我们将使用Remix 你可以通过访问以下链接访问Remix：Remix IDE 首先，创建solidity智能合约文件。 在Remix窗口内，点击左侧面板的「合约」文件夹，然后点击中央面板的 「新文件 」按钮。 现在你将被提示，为新的 Solidity 智能合约输入一个文件名。 文件名是任意的，但为了这个例子，我们将部署一个ERC-20智能合约，所以我们将文件命名为 「Test_ERC20.sol」。 输入文件名并按输入. 光标应移至编辑面板，您可在此输入您的 Solidity 代码。 光标应移至编辑面板，您可在此输入您的 Solidity 代码。 输入以下内容： pragma solidity ^0.7.0; import "https://github.com/OpenZeppelin/openzeppelin-contracts/blob/v3.4.0-solc-0.7/contracts/token/ERC20/ERC20.sol"; contract Token is ERC20 { constructor () ERC20("Token", "TKN") { _mint(msg.sender, 1000000 * (10 ** uint256(decimals()))); } } 接下来，点击屏幕左侧的「Solidity编译器」 图标，选择一个编译器版本(对于这个例子，我们将使用 0.7.6+commit.7338295f), 然后点击「编译Test_ERC20.sol」，如图所示。 点击左边的「部署和运行交易」图标，从 「环境」下拉选择 「Injected Web3」如图所示。 这将弹出MetaMask屏幕，您需要点击 「下一步」然后点击「连接」将您的C1钱包与Remix连接。 现在你的MetaMask钱包已经连接好了，点击「部署」按钮，将智能合约部署到Milkomeda C1侧链。 在MetaMask中确认该交易。 现在您应该在Remix IDE屏幕左侧的「已部署的合同」 下看到以下内容。 最后，让我们看看如何在Cardano Testnet上将我们的milkTADA解包成tADA。

现在我们准备从Cardano测试网的龙头获得一些测试ADA。 info 如果您将在Milkomeda C1的主网版本上使用真正的ADA，请跳过这一步，进入下一页。 在Flint钱包窗口内，点击"接收"。 在接收窗口，点击 「复制地址」将您的 Cardano 测试网钱包地址复制到剪贴板。 然后单击「Testnet龙头(tADA)」如屏幕下方显示。 ​ 这将带你到以下链接: Cardano Testnet龙头​ 在这里，从下拉菜单中选择「tAda」，并将你的Cardano testnet钱包地址贴上「地址」栏。 您可以将 「API 密钥」留空。 完成验证码，然后单击「请求资金」。 等待几分钟后(通常5分钟或更短)，你应该能在你的Cardano Testnet钱包中看到一些tADA。 接下来我们将设置MetaMask，并在Milkomeda C1侧链获得一个地址。

Milkomeda Cardano Unwrap Bridge是一个将资产从Milkomeda Cardano Testnet转移到Cardano主网的工具。 按照以下步骤，解开milkTADA的包装，在你的Cardano Testnet钱包中收到tADA。 首先，访问 Milkomeda Cardano Unwrap Bridge for Devnet 并连接您的 MetaMask 钱包。 接下来，输入要解开的milkADA的数量，并在 「收件人」栏贴上你的Cardano Testnet钱包地址。 然后，点击「下一步」按钮。 在 MetaMask 中确认操作。 在等待必要的交易确认约3至5分钟后，你应该在你的Cardano Testnet钱包中看到未包装的tADA。
了解如何将您的web3钱包或其他dApp与Milkomeda整合起来
下面的文章有助于了解milkomeda-js-sdk包，允许开发人员在Milkomeda侧链上整合web3钱包。
documents.s: 开始构建分散财务的未来

documents.t: 1. 1. 下载 milkomeda-js-sdk 包 您可以在这里找到 milkomeda-js-sdk 包。 这是一个承载Milkomeda部署的静态配置的包。 info 这对于避免每个项目整合Milkomeda硬编码静态配置是很有用的。 2. 2. 安装 milkomeda-js-sdk 软件包 使用 npm 安装包： npm i @dcspark/milkomeda-js-sdk 使用 yarn 安装包： yarn add @dcspark/milkomeda-js-sdk 3. 3. 将该软件包导入你的项目中 使用 import: import { generateMilkomedaMetadata, milkomedaNetworks } from "@dcspark/milkomeda-js-sdk"; 使用 require： const milkomedaJsSdk = require("@dcspark/milkomeda-js-sdk");
documents.s: 整合钱包与 Milkomeda 协议

documents.t: Milkomeda-js-sdk是一个承载Milkomeda部署的静态配置的包。 这对于避免每个项目整合Milkomeda硬编码静态配置是很有用的。 参数 说明 isMainnet boolean告知特定的网络配置是否是主网(如Cardano) mainchain 由主链信息组成，如协议和它的id sidechain 由侧链信息组成，如协议名称(如MilkomedaC1)和侧链id backendEndpoint 提供了服务的URL值，它暴露了关于侧链特定版本的额外信息 protocolMagic 介绍了与适当的Milkomeda网络兼容的协议魔法(protocol magic) timeIntervalForAddressMs 以毫秒为单位定义的可能的地址变化的时间间隔 sidechainContract 侧链合约的地址，任何客户端都可以连接到该地址 暴露有效载荷的例子​ 下面你可以找到一个暴露的Milkomeda网络(devnet)的有效载荷的例子 { [NETWORK_NAME]: { isMainnet: false, name: NETWORK_NAME, mainchain: { protocol: ProtocolNames.cardanoProtocol, id: toChainId({ networkId: registry.Testnet.NetworkId, networkMagic: registry.Testnet.NetworkMagic }) }, sidechain: { protocol: ProtocolNames.evmProtocol, id: 200101 }, backendEndpoint: BackendEndpoints.devnet, protocolMagic: ProtocolMagic.devnet, timeIntervalForAddressMs: 86400000, sidechainContract: "0x000000000000000000000000000000000000BbBB" }, } 此外，该包还引入了辅助类型和一个有助于为Milkomeda交易创建适当元数据的函数。 # Milkomeda metadata generator generateMilkomedaMetadata( address, # address is EVM address protocolMagic # protocol magic for specific network ) 交易的元数据由两个参数组成 - 协议魔法& EVM地址 Testnet交易的示范性元数据如下。 Testnet交易的示范性元数据如下。 { 87: "devnet.cardano-evm.c1" 88: "0xEVM_TESTNET_ADDRESS" } 为交易生成Milkomeda元数据的例子​ generateMilkomedaMetadata("0x000…", milkomedaNetworks["c1-devnet"].protocolMagic); info 记住用你的EVM地址替换「0x000...」
documents.s: 了解更多关于 milkomeda-js-sdk 软件包

documents.t: 除了Milkomeda-js-sdk包，我们已经引入了一个REST API，可以获取更多关于Milkomeda侧链本身的数据。 info 在这个例子中，为了更好地解释，我们使用了Flint钱包的整合案例 REST API的基本网址作为backendEndpoint参数使用milkomeda-js-sdk。 你可以用下面的代码把它从包里取出来: Devnet Mainnet milkomedaNetworks["c1-devnet"].backendEndpoint info 结果: https://allowlist.flint-wallet.com 当你的代码中包含了基本的URL，你可以使用以下的一个端点: Stargate address (V1/stargate) milkomedaNetworks["c1-mainnet"].backendEndpoint info 结果: https://allowlist-mainnet.flint-wallet.com 如果您想将您的钱包与Milkomeda主网整合，您需要使用另外两个终端，以获得网络上允许的EVM地址。 The purpose of this microservice is to provide a list of addresses that are allowed to use the bridge in Milkomeda. 这个[microservice] (https://github.com/dcSpark/allowedlist-service/)的目的是提供一个允许使用Milkomeda桥的地址列表。 当你的代码中包含基本的URL时，你可以使用以下的一个端点: Stargate address (/V1/stargate) fullAllowedList (/v1/fullAllowedList) 返回主网中允许的EVM地址数组 { "allowList": ["0x...", "0x..."] } isAddress=0x (/v1/isAddressAllowed?address=0x) 返回一个boolean值，告知所提供的地址是否被允许进入受限的主网。 使用Milkomeda REST API stargate 端点，你可以获得devnet和mainnet的相同属性的有效载荷。 在下方你可以看到devnet的一个有效载荷的例子： { "current_address": "addr_test1wz6lvjg3anml96vl22mls5vae3x2cgaqwy2ewp5gj3fcxdcw652wz", "ttl_expiry": 1646438400000, "ada": { "minLovelace": "3000000", "fromADAFeeLovelace": "500000", "toADAFeeGWei": "500000" }, "assets": [ { "idCardano": "b4004c2f3edfdd2016d0fead9b927064f345534b000000000000000000000000", "idMilkomeda": "9c223e1dAf6184672E982d9AA560D9FD1d09A01B", "minCNTInt": "1", "minGWei": "1000000000" } … ] } 如果您对本文和Milkomeda整合有任何其他问题，请访问https://www.milkomeda.com/support或访问我们的discord服务器，请不要犹豫，与我们联系。​

打开Flint钱包窗口，点击「发送」。 在下一个屏幕，启用「Milkomeda模式」切换，将您的Milkomeda C1钱包地址贴上到「Milkomeda以太坊地址」区域，并输入要发送的金额(本例中为300 Test ADA)。 点击继续。 在确认屏幕上，输入你的钱包密码并点击「发送」。 转移将需要10次确认，这应该需要大约5分钟。 一旦交易被确认，在您的MetaMask的Milkomeda Cardano Testnet钱包中应该可见到转移的MilkTADA。 关于交易费用的备注 对于仅在Milkomeda C1侧链上进行的交易，您只需支付由区块生产商设定的标准Milkomeda网络交易费用。 然而，涉及包装的交易，即在Cardano和Milkomeda C1侧链之间移动资产，需要为Cardano和Milkomeda支付交易费用，因为每条链上都需要进行一次交易。 例如，从Cardano向Milkomeda C1发送资产需要在Cardano上进行一笔交易来锁定你的资产，在Milkomeda C1上进行另一笔交易来向你发放包装好的资产。 当在Flint钱包中发送这种类型的交易时，你可以展开「网络费用」项目，看到一个 「基本费用」（如Cardano交易费用）和一个 「Milkomeda费用」。 请注意，这些交易的「Milkomeda费」将略高于Milkomeda的标准交易费，因为您也要向区块生产商支付他们在包裹您的资产方面的作用。 现在，我们已经成功地将Test ADA包装成MilkTADA，用于Milkomeda Cardano Testnet侧链，下一步是部署一个样本智能合约。 :::警告 MilkTADA 和包装测试 ADA 正如我们所看到的，MilkTADA是Milkomeda Cardano Testnet侧链上用于支付费用和gas的基本资产。 当您将Test ADA转移到Milkomeda时，您会收到MilkTADA。 「包装Test ADA」（wTADA）是一个独立的ERC20代币，其功能与以太坊上的WETH相同。 wTADA的合同地址如下。 请注意，尽管你可以向这个地址发送milkTADA来包装它，但你不应该向这个地址发送wTADA来解除包装，而应该使用智能合约中的正确方法与它进行互动。 wTADA 合同地址：0x65a51E52eCD17B641f8F0D1d56a6c9738951FDC9 如果使用Cardano主网，找到下面的wADA合约地址。 请勿直接向此地址发送WADA。 目前，你将需要使用DEX来解开wADA（或直接与智能合约互动）。 wADA 合同地址：0xAE83571000aF4499798d1e3b0fA0070EB3A3E3F9 ::::

Milkomeda C1侧链使用MilkADA作为其基础资产，用于支付费用和gas。 要访问侧链，你将需要一个有一些ADA的Cardano钱包以及MetaMask浏览器扩展。 在以下几页中，我们将通过以下步骤来创建一个Flint的Cardano钱包，配置MetaMask以获得Milkomeda C1的地址，最后发送ADA以转换为Milkomeda C1的MilkADA。 我们的第一步是安装Flint钱包。 前往下一页开始。

本节介绍Milkomeda Bridge接Cardano支持的所有本地代币。 要包装和解除任何受支持的本地资产，请按照給最终用户部分介绍的步骤教程，将milkADA替换为下表中的任何标记。 info 请记住，特定的本地资产必须被添加到Milkomeda Token Registry，才能用于任何包装或解包操作。 因此，该列表是有限的，只允许特定的本地代币。 支持 Milkomeda 本地资产列表： 代币名称 代币Ticker 合同地址详情 代币类型 GeroWallet GERO 0xeA55e366Eb0f4cFAAf8d83dC1fC7286F11b5b1cb ERC-20 Charli3 C3 0xdE482b84360c248C0d7260826a8B06a5A837235d ERC-20 CARD.STARTER CARDS 0xa350679eaFDb5836da9A796fF721a1fd8415c75F ERC-20 Occam OCX 0xf0c73E6287867bAa4F865A17EE711ec989c78AC0 ERC-20 IAGON IAG 0x658b95858457549cFC0af513b1b902aB0F6E6946 ERC-20 HOOSKY HOOSKY 0x13fe17701861b769d58f44c2cEBd918886d3D205 ERC-20 MUESLISWAP MILK MILK 0x386e685B5cBAa7bC06e3Dd2eEcDC56105076e4Fa ERC-20 World Mobile Token WMT 0x4D5C63c07463EFa5bb26EE0A6D8C39dd0e3DaBD9 ERC-20 Blueshift BLUES 0x8c008BBA2Dd56b99f4A6aB276bE3a478cB075F0C ERC-20 SundaeSWAP SUNDAE 0x771cc58a257a458b0A7C74382eA1C4EF856B80a8 ERC-20 WETH(Nomad) WETH 0x5950F9B6EF36f3127Ea66799e64D0ea1f5fdb9D1 ERC-20 WBTC(Nomad) WBTC 0x48AEB7584BA26D3791f06fBA360dB435B3d7A174 ERC-20 Tether USD(Nomad) USDT 0xab58DA63DFDd6B97EAaB3C94165Ef6f43d951fb2 ERC-20 USD Coin(Nomad) USD Coin(Nomad) 0x5a955FDdF055F2dE3281d99718f5f1531744B102 ERC-20 Wing Riders Token WRT 0xAA761861322Ca1cB8c0aCEB1471B3B5AF81de5A6 ERC-20 当使用 Milkomeda Cardano Unwrap Bridge 来 解包 一个特定的本地资产时，请从下拉列表中选择它，如下图所示： :::info 在选择了所需的本地资产后，你可以随时查看其描述(例如，在选择MILK代币时，为MuesliSwap生态系统提供动力的实用代币) :::
documents.s: Cardano Bridge 支持的本地资产

documents.t: Flint钱包是一个Chrome扩展程序，作为DeFi和NFT的常用轻型钱包。 当前版本的Flint允许用户启用「Milkomeda模式」，将交易发送到Milkomeda C1侧链。 在使用Chrome浏览器时访问以下链接，并点击 「添加到Chrome 」按钮，即可安装Flint钱包: 安装Flint 钱包 安装后，点击Chrome窗口右上方的图标，来访问你的扩展程序。 选择 Flint 选择 Flint 在Flint钱包窗口中，通过最初的警告屏幕，点击 「让我开始」，选择你的语言，点击「我同意」，当你到达下图所示屏幕时，点击「Mainnet」按钮。 接下来，点击「确认」，「创建一个新钱包」，并写下你的恢复短语的副本。 在下一个屏幕上确认恢复短语，设置一个钱包密码，并点击「创建我的钱包」。 现在你可以在应用程序密码界面选择「跳过」，然后点击「完成」。 你现在应该有一个Cardano钱包，如图所示： 请注意，要想进一步发展，你需要用一些ADA来资助你的钱包。 如果你在这个阶段需要帮助或遇到麻烦，请参考本文件末尾的"寻求帮助"部分。 接下来，我们将配置MetaMask以连接到Milkomeda C1侧链。

下一步是在Milkomeda C1侧链上获得一个地址，我们可以在那里接收我们的MilkADA。 目前，我们建议使用MetaMask来完成这一步骤。 首先，安装Chrome浏览器的MetaMask。 然后，点击Chrome扩展程序图标 并选择MetaMask。 在MetaMask窗口，点击「开始」然后,「创建一个钱包」。 设置钱包密码，并点击完成其余的设置屏幕。 完成后，你应该有一个新的空钱包，如下图所示。 选择MetaMask屏幕右上方的网络下拉菜单。 从下拉列表中，选择「添加网络」，并输入以下内容： Network Name: Milkomeda Cardano (C1) New RPC URL: https://rpc-mainnet-cardano-evm.c1.milkomeda.com Chain ID: 2001 Currency Symbol (Optional): MilkADA Block Explorer URL (Optional): https://explorer-mainnet-cardano-evm.c1.milkomeda.com 点击「**保存**」， 你现在应该在网络下拉菜单中看到「**Milkomeda Cardano (C1)**」。 如图所示，通过点击账户名称，将你的C1钱包地址复制到剪贴板。 现在我们准备返回Flint钱包，将我们的ADA转换为MilkADA。

打开Flint钱包窗口，点击「发送」。 在下一个屏幕，启用「Milkomeda模式」切换，将您当前剪贴板中的Milkomeda C1钱包地址贴上到「Milkomeda以太坊地址」区域，并输入要发送的金额(本例中为1 ADA)。 然后点击继续。 在确认屏幕上，输入你的钱包密码并点击「发送」。 转移将需要10次确认，这应该需要大约5分钟。 一旦交易被确认，在您的MetaMask的C1钱包中应该可见到转移的MilkADA。 ::info 关于交易费用的说明 对于仅在Milkomeda C1侧链上进行的交易，您只需支付由区块生产商设定的标准Milkomeda网络交易费用。 然而，涉及包装的交易，即在Cardano和Milkomeda C1侧链之间移动资产，需要为Cardano和Milkomeda支付交易费用，因为每条链上都需要进行一次交易。 例如，从Cardano向Milkomeda C1发送资产需要在Cardano上进行一笔交易来锁定你的资产，在Milkomeda C1上进行另一笔交易来向你发放包装好的资产。 当在Flint钱包中发送这种类型的交易时，你可以展开「网络费用」项目，看到一个 「基本费用」（如Cardano交易费用）和一个 「Milkomeda费用」。 请注意，这些交易的「Milkomeda费」将略高于Milkomeda的标准交易费，因为您也要向区块生产商支付他们在包裹您的资产方面的作用。 ::: 现在你已经成功地将你的ADA包装成MilkADA，并在Milkomeda C1侧链上使用。 :::注意 「MilkADA」vs「包装过的ADA」 MilkADA 是Milkomeda C1 sidechain上的基本资产。 当您将ADA转移到Milkomeda时，您会收到MilkADA。 除了MilkADA之外，还有一种叫做「已包装ADA」或WADA的代币。 已包装ADA是一种ERC20代币，其功能与以太坊的WETH相同。 小心不要把这些东西混淆！ ::: :::info 要检查可用的可包装的代币列表，请到Cardano Bridge Supported Native Assets部分。 :::

要将资产从Milkomeda C1侧链转移回Cardano，请使用Milkomeda Cardano Unwrap Bridge。 按照以下步骤，解开milkADA的包装，在你的Cardano mainnet钱包中收到ADA。 首先，访问 Milkomeda Cardano Unwrap Bridge 并连接您的 MetaMask 钱包。 点击 「下一步」 连接到 Milkomeda C1 侧链 :::警告 记住在你的钱包中选择适当的网络。 只连接到您信任的网站。 请确保网站URL如下：https://cardano-bridge.milkomeda.com ::: 接下来，输入要解包的milkADA的数量，或点击箭头选择不同的资产解包，并在「收件人」栏贴上你的Cardano钱包地址。 然后，点击「下一步」按钮。 点击 「确认」来签名交易，解包MetaMask的资产。 接着，等待区块链确认。 info 你可以在Cardanoscan explorer中检查交易细节，以了解更多信息。 在这个阶段，你的浏览器的地址栏将包含一些关于解包交易的信息。 下图显示了一个例子。 地址栏中的这些元素的含义如下： EVM 解包交易 ID 未包装的代币金额 被解开的代币的名称 要查询有关解包交易的更多详细信息，请进入Milkomeda Blockscout explorer，将EVM解包交易ID贴上 到搜索框中，如下图所示。 查询示例交易 现在解包过程已经完成。 在等待必要的交易确认后，你应该在你的Cardano Mainnet钱包中看到解开的资产。 :::info 要检查可用的可解包的代币列表，请到Cardano Bridge Supported Native Assets部分。 :::
我们强烈建议在 discord上加入我们的频道。 许多开发者和社区成员积极及主动地提供指导和支持。 您也可以参考 Milkomeda 常见问题 并通过我们的 联系页面 联系我们。
